data.title: Julian Bonilla Diego - Mid-City Community Advocacy Network
data.meta_description: After graduating from UC Riverside, working for Mid-City CAN has been an enlightening and… · Experience: Mid-City Community Advocacy Network · Education: University of California, Riverside · Location: San Diego · 42 connections on LinkedIn. View Julian Bonilla Diego’s profile on LinkedIn, a professional community of 1 billion members.
data.text:
We are thrilled to announce the official launch of Generational Wellness, a non-profit organization in Murrieta, CA that provides accessible and affordable mental health services to individuals, couples, and families. 🚀 Our Mission: To heal past traumas and foster a healthier future for all generations. 💡 Did You Know? 👉 Over 50% of adults in the U.S. will experience mental illness in their lifetime. 👉 The COVID-19 pandemic has significantly increased the need for mental health services. How We Make a Difference: 1. Reduced-Cost Therapy: Sliding scale therapy services to ensure everyone can access quality mental health care. 2. Free Therapy Partnerships: Collaborating with other non-profits to provide free therapy to underserved populations. 3. Service Initiatives: Local volunteer opportunities and international service trips to promote empathy and global understanding. 💪 Follow Us for updates on our journey and ways you can contribute to creating a healthier future for all generations. We cannot wait to serve our community! #MentalHealth #GenerationalWellness #NonProfit #CommunityService #WellnessJourney #HealingTogether #SupportMentalHealth

2

1 Comment

📈 Baja California sets records in job creation! 🌟 During the first two months of 2024, 22,753 jobs were created, solidifying Baja California as the third state with the highest labor growth, representing 8.6% of the national total. 🚀 👨‍💼 Most of the new jobs are permanent (53.6%), followed by jobs in the agricultural sector (40.1%) and temporary positions (6.3%). With 8,545 employments, Tijuana continues to lead in regional job creation. 🌾 💡 In January and February, large companies were pivotal, generating 92.6% of new formal jobs (21,079), while SMEs contributed 4.0% (919 jobs). 🔍 🏭 The primary sector and the manufacturing industry are the main drivers of employment, with 9,130 and 8,130 new positions respectively. 📊 Discover more about the job market in Baja California! https://buff.ly/3W4lBJy 📞 (664) 681-8344 📲 contact@tijuanaedc.org 💻 tijuanaedc.org #TrustedEcosystem #InvestInTJ #TijuanaEDC #Innovation #EconomicDevelopment #GlobalEconomy

3

TOMORROW MORNING (SATURDAY APRIL 20TH) at 10:30 AM our amazing Who I Am Foundation volunteers in #Albuquerque will be having our next Community Clean-Up (ABQ)! For this Community Clean-Up our volunteers will meet up at, and clean the neighborhood around Mesa Verde Community Center located at 7900 Marquette NE Albuquerque NM 87108 NO OPEN-TOED SHOES Cleaning up loose trash is one of the best ways to pitch in for your community and the environment. Volunteering as a means to help conserve and protect the environment has a lot of upsides. Of course, the first is that you’ll be taking care of our planet, and it badly needs a little love given the myriad ways in which we’ve become adept at destroying it. But beyond that, volunteering for a cause you care about is a great way to meet like-minded people, make friends, and pull yourself out of the blues that sometimes accompany caring a lot about something important – especially if you feel alone in your endeavors. None of us like the sight of litter. Litter spoils the look of where we live but that’s not the only reason for picking up litter. There are a number of benefits from picking up litter that you may not have considered before. Volunteer-led projects such as these are one of the quickest, simplest, and least expensive ways to inspire more community spirit and civic action. A visually appealing community increases property values, attracts businesses, and improves the neighborhood's image. Beauty is one of the three most influential factors in community attachment, which means loyalty, to your particular town or city. Some research even shows that a nice-looking neighborhood promotes good behavior. Join us in keeping your community clean! For more information: https://lnkd.in/g2ByASKE #TeamWhoIAm_Albuquerque

44% of Madera County residents speak Spanish at home. Because of this, Madera County Animal Services in California has prioritized communicating in both English and Spanish. Director Amy Toler says their many bilingual employees are critical in this process. They publish as much as they can in both languages, and not just the important legal documents. Toler says it's important to share "the fun stuff as well" with their Spanish-speaking community. You can find adoption specials, microchip clinics flyers, pet safety tips - you name it - in English and Spanish on their Facebook page. Pro Tip: For printed documents, they put both English and Spanish into one document because it's more cost-efficient and cuts down on paperwork. It can also help non-Spanish speakers provide customer service to Spanish speakers, because they can easily reference the English word next to the Spanish word. Keep expanding your reach with multilingual marketing: https://lnkd.in/eT9czCNe

💲 The Paid Family Leave (PFL) Grant Program is now open! Eligible small businesses across California can now apply for grants of up to $2,000 per employee through California’s Paid Family Leave (PFL) program. This initiative, funded by the California Employment Training Panel and the California Labor and Workforce Development Agency, aims to support small businesses in managing the additional costs incurred when employees take leave. California’s PFL program offers eligible employees up to eight weeks of wage replacement benefits for qualifying reasons, including bonding with a new child or caring for a seriously ill family member. Small businesses with 1 to 100 employees that have at least one employee utilizing PFL on or after June 1, 2024, are encouraged to apply for these grants. To qualify for the grant, businesses must: • Be registered to do business in the State of California • Be in an active status with the California Secretary of State’s Office • Have an active California Employer Account Number under which employees are listed for payroll To apply and for eligibility, visit: CaliforniaPFL.com

Exciting news coming out of #NewMexico! 🌟 We're thrilled to announce that the City of Albuquerque and Bernalillo County have teamed up with Unite Us to seamlessly connect residents to social services. This partnership will enhance connectivity and coordination of care, ensuring that no one falls through the cracks. 🗨️ “Health is measured in more than just medical care. Food security, housing security, transportation, and child care are all critical to the health of our communities, so we’re making sure people can get connected to the right help for them. With this investment, we’re ensuring that Albuquerque families have better tools to access the resources they need," said Mayor Tim Keller. How It Works: 🔎 𝐈𝐝𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐢𝐟𝐢𝐜𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐨𝐟 𝐍𝐞𝐞𝐝𝐬: Healthcare providers and community organizations conduct screenings for social needs like food insecurity or housing instability. 🔗 𝐒𝐞𝐜𝐮𝐫𝐞 𝐑𝐞𝐟𝐞𝐫𝐫𝐚𝐥𝐬: If needs are identified, electronic, HIPAA-compliant referrals are sent to appropriate organizations through the Unite Us platform. ✅ 𝐂𝐥𝐨𝐬𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐋𝐨𝐨𝐩: Service providers update the platform with referral outcomes, ensuring coordinated care. Read more in the full #pressrelease ⏩ https://bit.ly/462sRue #HealthcareTransformation #SocialCare #HealthTech

Are you or a loved one a senior enrolled in Medi-Cal? 🤔 If so, you'll want to know about the California Advancing and Innovating Medi-Cal (CalAIM) program—a transformative initiative that's set to bring significant benefits to our senior population across the state. Here's why CalAIM matters for seniors: 1️⃣ Whole Person Care: CalAIM focuses on addressing not just medical needs but also the broader social determinants of health that impact seniors' well-being. From access to affordable housing to mental health support and beyond, CalAIM is designed to provide comprehensive care that considers the unique needs of each individual. 2️⃣ Innovative Care Models: The program introduces innovative care models tailored to seniors, such as enhanced care management and expanded access to community-based services. These models aim to improve health outcomes and enhance the quality of life for seniors by providing personalized, coordinated care. 3️⃣ Equity and Diversity: CalAIM prioritizes health equity, aiming to reduce disparities in health outcomes among seniors from diverse backgrounds. By addressing social determinants of health and promoting culturally competent care, CalAIM strives to ensure that all seniors have equal access to high-quality healthcare services. 4️⃣ Simplification and Streamlining: One of the key goals of CalAIM is to simplify administrative processes and streamline access to care for seniors enrolled in Medi-Cal. This means less paperwork, easier navigation of the healthcare system, and more time spent on what matters most—improving health and well-being. As California continues to innovate and advance its Medicaid program, seniors enrolled in Medi-Cal can look forward to enhanced support, improved access to care, and a renewed focus on holistic well-being. Stay tuned for more updates on CalAIM and how it's shaping the future of healthcare for seniors in our state! #CalAIM #MediCal #SeniorCare #HealthcareInnovation 🚀🌈💙

3

We did it! The NSBAC, as part of a mighty coalition of small business owners, small business support and advocacy organizations and community leaders, helped safeguard a vital support program for California small businesses. The Technical Assistance Program was on the chopping block for a proposed $13.1 million budget cut, 56.5 percent of the program's annual funding, but the grassroots efforts and unity of this coalition, along with supportive legislators of pro-small business policies, is what delivered this victory for the 4.1 million small businesses in California. “This is a victory for every voice that spoke up, whether in-person, online or in print against budget cuts to TAP,” said NSBAC President Allison Allain. “In this case, it didn’t just take a village, it took a whole state working together to protect small business owners.” Sign up to join NSBAC to help deliver more victories for small businesses at NSBAC dot US #smallbusiness #smallbusinessadvocacy #californiasmallbusiness #saveTAP

8

3 Comments

Our founder and fearless Latina Leader Yohana I. Quiróz, Ed.D. wrote a piece about our work at Unidos for ECE and the importance of "Empowering Latino Leadership in ECE: A Vision for Change" California stands as a beacon of innovation and diversity, with Latinos poised to represent 45% of the population by 2060. However, a critical gap persists: while 46% of the ECE workforce is Latinas, only 12% hold leadership roles in the field. At Unidos for ECE, we stand as the pioneering organization founded and led by Latinas, committed exclusively to forging paths of leadership for fellow Latinas in the realm of early care and education. Our focus is clear: to bridge this leadership gap and unapologetically support Latinas in early care and education. As pioneers in this movement, we're committed to forging pathways of leadership exclusively for Latinas, both within and beyond the ECE sphere. We aim not just to empower but to elevate the Latino community, ensuring their amplified influence and substantial representation and contributions to championing the well-being of all children, but particularly Latino children and families. Recognizing the unique challenges faced by Latina leaders, we delve into intersectionality in leadership, addressing factors such as race, gender, and socio-economic background to foster inclusive leadership reflective of the diverse communities we serve. At the heart of our strategy is our catalyst program-- ELLA-ES, our initiative to build a robust culturally and linguistically responsive and sustaining Latina leadership pipeline. We advocate for intentional efforts to identify, mentor, train and support emergent Latina leaders. Collaboration with philanthropy and organizations, both within and outside the education sector, is pivotal to strengthening this pipeline. Measuring success is not just a goal but a commitment. We define key performance indicators and success metrics for developing Latina leadership in ECE, and Unidos for ECE is unwavering in its dedication to tracking and evaluating the impact of its initiatives. Join us in this transformative journey! Unidos, podemos! #Latinaleaders #ECE #UnidosforECE www.unidosforece.org

Who is Dominick Haider? Dominick Haider is a BJJ black belt and founder of @guardianlosangeles Living in South LA has shown @dnhaider30 that despite the community’s bad rep, residents just want to live and thrive. Lack of investments, resources, and recreational activities make this difficult. With few available/affordable opportunities to participate in, bad influences may drastically affect the trajectory of youth lives in a negative way Dominick wanted to help change this and reached out to @calder.powers (Director of @guardiangym), who offered him the opportunity to open Guardian Gym LA: a place where youths now go to have fun, socialize, study, clear their minds, eat something healthy, and exercise/train – greatly helping students and supporting their families “Jiu Jitsu, to me, is a vehicle to help these kids find a healthy community when oftentimes their communities are lacking or failing them. Our program is structured so that these kids are provided with valuable mentorship and opportunities to learn how to mentor others. As instructors, our focus is to convey discipline, compassion, perseverance, and strong moral character which in turn is mirrored by them and trickles down to every new student that comes in. Unlike many sports or afterschool programs, Guardian classes run year round (and they can do it for the rest of their lives) so these kids always know a place they can go and count on to be there for them, which is invaluable. We all matter. Jiu Jitsu can help EVERYONE but it isn’t available to everyone that wants or needs it. A quote I heard recently is that ‘Talent is universal, Opportunity is not’ – one that many don’t realize or forget. This can be applied to anything and one of Guardian’s main principles is [to] provide that opportunity to those that otherwise wouldn’t have it.” Learn more from the article on our website Fight For It. #sanabul #fighterseries #teamsanabul

Latinos Love Podcasts! 🎧 Monthly podcast listenership among Latinos has surged by 52% since 2020, with 38% of U.S. Latinos aged 18+ now tuning in regularly. This growth outpaces the general U.S. population by nearly four times! 📈 According to the fourth annual Latino Podcast Listener Report, Latino podcast listeners are highly engaged with ads. Nearly half (49%) have purchased a product or service after hearing it advertised on a podcast. Plus, 53% of those consuming Spanish-language podcasts find the ads more relatable. To make your brand unforgettable, leverage sonic branding—brands using music aligned with their identity are 96% more likely to be remembered. 🎶 Trust is key! 50% of Latino listeners have a more favorable opinion of companies mentioned on their favorite podcasts, and 54% trust Latino podcast hosts more than others. Confiamos en las recomendaciones de los paisanos! 🤝 #Podcasts #PodcastAds #SonicBranding #LatinoPower #MarketingTips #HispanicMarket #MexicansBeLike #Latino #FYP #California #texas #LA #Miami #Facts #LawyersLife #Lawyer
